TopicTitle: Part does not load into KSP - How to debug?

Articles.Content:
Okay this may be covered elsewhere already, but i did not felt like necro-ing an age old topic.

I've got Unity set up flawless and in Unity all looks splendid. All files got written by the PartTools plugin alright (.MU file and the two .MBMs), since the part is a rather simple fueltank thing and i know the right scale (i read up on those as well) i took a CFG file from the Squad Parts and modified it (replaced names and descriptions, and the attachment node offsets (i read up on those too). I triple checked the folder structure and now i'm running against a mental wall.

It simply won't load into KSP.

What did i missed? Where can i start to debug this? Did it got exported incorrectly? I got no clue

First step would be to try and export from Unity a couple times....sometimes is a pain like that.

Next thing you probably want to look at is texturing format. Some stuff will give KSP issues.Just to play it safe I usually limit myself to difuse and a normal map though I have heard of people using specular layers, I personaly have had only problems with em).

Just out of curiosity what model format did you import into Unity?

I took the maya file (.mb) directly. i also tried a .dae via DAE_FBX no luck. texture formats: i tried .tga (standard) and then tried jpeg. no luck either way. I mean it looks all fine in unity. It also lools as if everything ets converted right (including the MBM texture conversation) the CFG file i checked a dozen times now (interesting question: does the name in the CFG file needs to be the name of the actual model file name shown in unity before import?)

I think that may have been it. funny enough. the part shows up in the list LAST and not first like other mods. but that may be the loading order (the folder name is Test and that comes after Squad). now it is just slightly too large. but that might be because unity thinks that i used maya's default centimeter scale. easy fix tho

Edited December 21, 2013 by Aeon-Phoenix
Figured it out
